title: Rani Lakshmibai
summary: Lakshmibai, the Rani of Jhansi (pronunciation ; 19 November 1828 — 18 June 1858),[1][2] was an Indian queen, the Maharani consort of the Maratha princely state of Jhansi from 1843 to 1853 as the wife of Maharaja Gangadhar Rao.[3] She was one of the leading figures of the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and became a symbol of resistance to the British Raj for Indian nationalists. She died from wounds received in a battle on 18 June 1858. The rebellion was suppressed by the British forces in November of that year.
